column1: Sysert (Russian: Сысе́рть) is a town and the administrative center of Sysertsky District of Sverdlovsk Oblast
column3: located on the Sysert River (Ob basin
column5: 50 kilometers (31 mi) south of Yekaterinburg. Population: 20

column1: It was founded in either 1732 or in 1773 and was called Sysertsky Zavod (Сысертский Завод) until 1932. Town status was granted to it in 1946.
Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Sysert serves as the administrative center of Sysertsky District and is subordinated to it. As a municipal division
column3: the town of Sysert together with thirty-seven rural localities in Sysertsky District is incorporated as Sysertsky Urban Okrug.
